definition:
Let $X$ be a topological space and let $\mathcal B$ be a basis of its
topology. We can regard $\mathcal B$ as a category with objects being
the open sets in $\mathcal B$ and arrows/morphisms between
$U,V\in\mathcal B$ to exists only if $U\subset V$, and where the *only*
element of $\mathcal B(U,V)$ is the injection map $U\hookrightarrow V$.
Let now ${\mathcal{C}}$ be a complete category, we now define the
*presheaf of ${\mathcal{C}}$-objects over the basis $\mathcal B$ of the
topology of $X$* to be a contravariant functor
$${\mathcal{P}}:\mathcal B\rightarrow {\mathcal{C}}$$
